name: ORDER_MED_7
description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.

columns.name: MED_DOSAGE_END_DATE
columns.description: Stores the calculated end date of the order when using the wide end date feature

columns.name: FIRST_DOSE_EDU_PATIENT_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number of the patient encounter associated with first-dose education.

columns.name: PENDED_PREV_SIG
columns.description: For a pended medication order, this holds the contents (if any) of the "Sig (Previous)" display item from the order composer.  If populated, this is the sig (ORD 7055) of the source order at the time the reorder was created.

columns.name: DOSE_ADJ_ACCEPTED_YN
columns.description: Stores whether the dose adjustment is accepted.

columns.name: MED_DOSE_CALCULATION_DESC
columns.description: Stores medication dose override dose programming point calculation.

columns.name: NUM_DOSES_TO_SCHED
columns.description: Stores the number of doses that should actually be scheduled after reconciling a pre-existing OP order into an encounter which schedules OP meds

columns.name: DO_NOT_SCHED_PAST_DATE
columns.description: Stores the last date on which it is OK to schedule an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SCHED_FROM_PERIOD
columns.description: Stores the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SCHED_FROM_PERIOD_DURATION
columns.description: Stores the remaning number of days in the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SEND_TO_PHARM_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: Reasons for sending a prescription directly to a pharmacy. For Australia e-prescribing.

columns.name: RX_MOBILE_NUM
columns.description: Patient's mobile phone number. For Australia e-prescribing.

columns.name: MED_PROV_ORDER_ID
columns.description: Links to the shadow order containing provisional verify data

columns.name: TAPER_TRIMMING_INCOMPLETE_C_NAME
columns.description: Set to Yes if the taper trimming UI's decision hasn't been made yet

columns.name: STARTED_TAKING_DATE
columns.description: The date the patient reports they started taking a medication

columns.name: RX_REQ_SUBTYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: This item specifies the subtype of the external change request this order represents. It is only set on orders created by external pharmacies, and is used in conjunction with ORD 7499.
entries: Waiting for PA, no recent updates
RxChange - DEA License Status in Prescribing State
E-Prescribing Cancel Response Follow Up Needed
Patient Submitted Data Failed Validation Notification

columns.name: RESCARE_REORDER_C_NAME
columns.description: Response to a question that a user is shown when reordering or modifying an outpatient order while the patient is admitted to a residential care facility.
entries: Discontinue Original and Specify Start Date
Default Start After Original Order Ends

columns.name: DISCRETE_SIG_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The discrete sig source category ID for the order.

columns.name: MED_ORIG_DOSAGE_END_DATE
columns.description: Stores the original dosage end date for a medication order when using the wide end date feature if it was changed after the order was signed

columns.name: SCHED_FIRST_DOSE_DTTM
columns.description: Stores the date and time that the first dose in an admission should be scheduled

columns.name: LAST_REFILL_REQUEST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The datetime of when the patient last requested a refill for this medication order through MyChart. Used to determine when another refill can be requested for medications filled through non-integrated pharmacies.

columns.name: SCHEDULE_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number of the Patient contact for when Low Acuity scheduling information is saved to an order (SI 34570).

columns.name: SOURCE_SCHED_IN_PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for the low-acuity admission contact if the source order is schedulable in that admission when the current order is signed or released. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: SCHEDULE_USING_METHOD_C_NAME
columns.description: The schedule using method category ID for the order. This determines how the medication should schedule administration due times in an encounter that supports scheduling outpatient medications on the MAR.

columns.name: NEED_INTAKE_SCHED_YN
columns.description: Stores whether the medication needs intake to be scheduled, even if it was ordered directly on the low acuity encounter.

columns.name: RX_WRITTEN_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC instant of when the prescription was written

columns.name: REMAINING_DOSES_BEFORE_INTAKE
columns.description: The system will track the number of doses remaining for the order prior to the most recent intake into a low acuity medication management encounter.

columns.name: MED_CHG_REPLACE_YN_NAME
columns.description: Flag to determine if I ORD 7088 - Med change reorder ID is actually a replacement ID.
